title: Connection issues after relocating to another City in New Zealand.
body:
So about a week ago I moved to Dunedin (a city in New Zealand) from Christchurch (another city in New Zealand). I came here to study meaning i had to switch isp, my new isp is Unifone, and from research i realize that Unifone is not the best for playing League and there has been troubles in the past. my issue is that I can't connect to games on the OCE server, this happens after I choose a champion, the loading screen will become black follwed by a message saying can't connect to the server please check your connection or something like that. I spent a lot of time trying to fix this or finding a way around the issue and have tried all the troubleshooting provided by RIOT. I checked to see if it's my league that's busted or if it is my internet provider, to do this I created an account on the NA server which works fine however with high ping, around 200. I then tried using a VPN to change my location to another country and retried my connection on the OCE server, this worked however with over 600 ping. Honestly I have no idea what the problem is, my guess is that it's packet loss and to fix this i need to talk to my isp, however seeing as i dont own the isp because im living in a communal flat I can't really fix it. So is there some way that RIOT can help me out with this, or is my league days over. I hope not because this is the only game i can really play with my friends. please help. 
Thank you, I hope a riot employee gets this.

replies.body:
Hi,

Thanks for getting in touch - I'm assuming one of the things you tried was going through the [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide?

One step that might be helpful - can you run a traceroute from your PC to the OCE game servers  and post the result?  [Instructions here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)

Cheers!
Mindstar

[](http://file:///C:/Users/Armand/Desktop/riot.htm)

these are the results of the trace using WinMTR

I realise that link won't work, im just trying to figure out how to attach a file, I can't seem to find out
Try uploading it to http://upload.wrenchmen.org/ and provide a link here. Alternatively, you can copy and paste the results to [**PasteBin**](http://pastebin.com/).
